Alzheimers Society Napier Inc provides services / support to the community of Napier who are affected by Alzheimers/dementia/memory loss, supporting the person with dementia (PWD), their carers/family/whanau.

It is our aim to help make each PWD's journey with the disease fun by encouraging independence, allowing them to stay at home with their loved ones for as long as possible (thereby delaying rest home entry). Allowing the carer/family/whanau a valuable "day off" knowing their loved one is safe and enjoying a sociable day - thereby empowering the carer/family/whanau.

ACC is a Crown entity responsible for: preventing injury; collecting personal injury cover levies; determining whether claims for injury are covered by the scheme and providing entitlements to those who are eligible; paying compensation; paying health and disability support services to treat, care for and rehabilitate injured people; advising the government. We provide accident cover, injury prevention services, case management, medical and other care and rehabilitation services.

Tel: 0800 844 657 for Injury Prevention enquiries (thinksafe@acc.co.nz) and Injury prevention officer. Tel: 0800 101 996 for claim related enquiries (claims@acc.co.nz) Tel:(06) 873 0200 for general enquiries. Tel: 0800 222 776 for levy enquiries (business@acc.co.nz)

We are career experts. We help people make informed learning and work choices so they, and the country will have a better future. Our work helps grow a skilled workforce and improves outcomes for young people by connecting learning to work and enhancing career-related services. We work in partnership with other Government Agencies to help boost skills and reduce long-term welfare dependence. We are a hub for information and advice on careers. Our strategy for 2015 - 2019 focuses on young people, Maori and Pasifika through: * Connecting educators and employers to improve career pathways at important transition points in people's learning and work lives. * Delivering professional development services for those influencing other people's career choices, to help them provide informed career support. * Developing new and existing digital tools and resources to help people make informed learning and work choices.

Hawke's Bay DHB has an interpreting service which is available to hospital patients and people in the community. This service is accessible 24 hours a day, seven days a week. To request an interpreter phone 06 878 8109 and ask the operator for the contact details of n interpreter in the language required. Currently over 30 languages are offered including New Zealand Sign Language. (The availability of languages is subject to change.) Interpreters provide face-to-face interpreting as well as interpreting over the phone. Interpreters help to bridge the communication gap in a multi-cultural society, and allow the professionals to use their time with clients more effectively.

We rely on the services of our many volunteers who collect food donations and pack food parcels on a weekly basis. Without their support Foodbank would cease to operate.
To provide emergency food relief that will assist in the enhancement and quality of life of those in our community with limited resources.

The Napier Community Foodbank is an independent, non government funded, Charitable Trust with a seven member Board of Trustees. We receive great support from the Napier community in the form of food and financial donations which aids directly in supplying emergency food parcels to those with limited resources. We also make funding applications to various philanthropic trusts and funding organisations to cover our yearly operational costs. We receive referrals from around 55 different health and welfare agencies within Napier (we do not take self referrals). Clients may access two food parcels a year with additional assistance available in certain circumstances for those working with an accredited budgeting programme. All assistance from Work & Income must be accessed first. In this way we ensure a fair and equitable distribution of the resources entrusted to us by the community.

Zonta International is a leading global organisation of professionals empowering women worldwide through service and advocacy.
Zonta International envisions a world in which women's rights are recognised as human rights and every women is able to achieve her full potential. Our dining room with its art deco themed mural, is often the center of activities and events. It’s where lots of visiting entertainers such as singers and musicians perform and themed celebrations take place. For more casual meetings, there’s a sunny nook for catching up with friends, with large windows providing expansive views to the gardens and hills beyond.
Monthly themed lunches are put on for residents and their families, such as Mid Winter Christmas, French (Bastille Day), Asian and a spring festival.
Regular weekly activities include housie, crosswords, outings, exercise, arts and crafts, church services, bowling, cooking classes and demonstrations, plus the well-attended happy hour and visits to the RSA.
Because everyone loves a bit of friendly competition, we take on some of the other homes in the area in bowling matches, quizzes and our version of Commonwealth Games.
We also keep it social (and less competitive) with shared outings to cafes and restaurants with other homes.
We often base our activities programme around a theme, for example Matariki. Over the duration of the month, we had a Kapa Haka concert and hangi, followed by demonstrations of flax weaving, poi making, carving and much, much more.

Our residents say Atawhai has a lovely homely feeling. The staff are friendly and helpful, and love what they do.

Te Taiwhenua o Heretaunga is a kaupapa Maori, iwi-mandated provider of health and social services, community development and cultural leadership.

Te Taiwhenua of Heretaunga was registered as an Incorporated Society 30 years ago. It provides iwi-mandated leadership and community support. Its board of trustees is elected by the marae of Heretaunga, and its governance is laid down in the TToH Deed.

Te Taiwhenua o Heretaunga is the local Maori authority for Hastings and the surrounding district. The organisation is a leading Maori health, education and social service provider with a comprehensive range of services for all ages.

Te Kupenga Hauora - Ahuriri provides Health, Social and Disability Services to all people within the Whanganui a Orotu (Napier) boundaries and nominated areas of Ngati Kahungunu (Hawkes Bay). Our Services are delivered from a Kaupapa Maori perspective and are mobile and free. The range of Health, Social and Disability Services we offer include: * Aukati Kai Paipa (Smoking Cessation) * Breast and Cervical Screening Support * Dental Educator / School-based Nursing * Mobile Primary Nursing & Health Promotion * Activity & Nutrition * Youth Services * Family Start * Kia Piki Te Ora (All age Suicide Prevention) * Social Workers in Schools * Whanau Ora.

Tena koutou katoa. Te Poho O Tangiianui Marae is an established urban Marae set amongst residential housing in the suburb of Greenmeadows. We cater for medium-sized groups (10 - 53 persons) who are looking for a venue to stage functions that last for between a few hours through to those who require accommodation for a few days.

As the City of Napier's first urban Marae, Te Poho O Tangiianui Marae is a Maori reservation that can be hired by Maori and non Maori. We are pleased to be able to host Meetings that last from one to several days. Accommodation in our comfortable and clean Wharenui is part of the package (33 persons). More space is available if required. Clean bedding, sheets, pillows and cases are supplied. We have a registered Kohanga Reo operating on site. Our aim is to make our guests feel welcome and to have them enjoy the experience.

Tena koutou katoa. Greetings to all. Established as Napier's first urban Marae (c.1983) we strive to provide our guests with a positively memorable experience. Included in the package is off street parking, a carved Meeting House (Tangiianui), a Conference room (named Puatara), Dining room (Moetuma) that can cater for up to 70 persons. There are hot showers (3) available. Our kitchen contains a full range of kitchen tools including pots, pans, utensils, cutlery etc. There are 3 fridges. The kaupapa or theme of our Marae is "Unity of the community".Standard charges are $350 for the first two nights then reducing to a lower rate by agreement. Our charge for a day's usage is $250. Bookings are essential. Nga mihi nui, Naomi (custodian).

Traditional Japanese Karate Training for kids, teens, adults and families.

Shotokan Karate is a demanding physical art and an outstanding total body exercise. It is a decisive method of self-defense, and a proven way to develop personal discipline for kids, and to manage stress for adults. It is an intense competitive sport, and, for some - it becomes a philosophy of life. It is an art that allows participants of all ages and at varying levels of intensity - from the recreational practitioner - to the internationally competitive athlete - to train to their full potential.

Basketball Activities for all ages and abilities.

BBHB was created in 2005 with an objective of coordinating basketball activities in the Hawkes Bay region including Napier, Hastings, Wairoa and central Hawkes Bay.
The mission of Basketball Hawke’s Bay is to promote and provide basketball programs and services for all levels and ages of participants that stimulate their health, development, and enjoyment in a safe environment and develop fitness, wellness, social interaction, team work, fair play, representative and leadership opportunities.
Vision During the next decade, Basketball Hawke’s Bay will be recognised as a leader in the delivery of recreational and competitive amateur basketball programs and services within New Zealand. We will deliver comprehensive programmes providing the highest quality participation experience that supports participant learning, life-long participation and physical wellness. Our programs will be conducted in a positive environment that fosters improved self-confidence, self-esteem and healthy lifestyles allowing people of all ages to participate, enjoy and excel at all levels.

The objectives of Deco Bay Brass Band Inc are: Teaching the playing of brass and percussion instruments, both solo and in concert performance. Promoting the advancement and study of brass and percussion music. Encouraging the appreciation of brass and percussion music by the public.

The Deco Bay Brass Band was formed in 2014 following the amalgamation of the Port of Napier Brass Band which was formed in 1868 and the Hastings Citizens' Band which was formed in 1880. Combined we boast over 280 years of Brass Banding in the Hawke's Bay region. Both bands have a proud tradition of providing top quality musical performance to its greater public audience and this is attested to by the results both bands have achieved at both National and District Championship competitions. Several of our players have been awarded National Championship titles at National Brass Band Championships. Both bands have over their time been well placed in the B Grade Band Competition. The newly formed band currently has five current or past National Brass Band of New Zealand members, two National Youth Brass Band members and one National Secondary Schools Brass Band member.

We provide free legal information, advice and assistance for people who are on a low income and cannot access legal aid. We also represent low income clients in mediations tribunals and in Coroner's Court. The areas we cover are tenancy, debt, neighbour disputes, insurance, employment, medical, family, paternity, immigration, benefits and welfare law, consumer issues, and some civil and human rights matters. We do not do wills or Enduring Power of Attorney or property conveyancing. We will also provide education sessions and speak to community groups and schools.

Our purpose is to ensure that children are nurtured, protected and safe from neglect and harm; that young people are also safe from harm and from offending. That their families are supported to provide adequate care and protection of their children. We have a team of qualified social workers and counsellors. We invest in quality training for our staff to ensure their skills are relevant to the complex needs of our families. Our staff all work with a strength-based, solution-forced model of practice and our counsellors also use a range of modalities suited to client needs. We have implemented a results based accountability framework to monitor and evaluate the work we do. This framework allows us to report the degree of difference we make with a client, the results they have achieved and the changes they have made. This information is important for our funders as well as helping us identify best practice and where practice may need to change.

Bellyful is a nationwide not-for-profit organisation, whose volunteers cook and deliver free meals to families with a new baby or struggling with a serious illness, primarily those lacking a good support network.

THE CRITERIA:
The family should have a baby under three months old and be lacking in a good support network
OR
The family has a seriously ill person in their family unit (parent or child) and be lacking in a good support network
If you have a family that you know is struggling in a situation a little outside this criteria (for example, the baby may be 5 months old but there is a lack of support and a difficult baby) then please do contact us to discuss the situation.
REFER:
You can refer any family (even your own!) and the best way to do this is to go to our website: www.bellyful.org.nz find the branch that covers your area and email the Area Coordinator directly.

Digitising Hawke's Bay history involves two types of volunteers, a generalist or a professional donating their time to this important community project. Tasks involve: scanning photos, documents, diaries, journals, magazines etc; overhead camera fir digitising maps and large documents; data entry recording excerps from books mentioning Hawke's Bay history; transcribing handwritten material so it can be OCR (Optical Character Recognition); information management involves preparing publishable material to be uploaded to Knowledge Bank website etc; website development and design; team leaders co-ordinating volunteers; communication and marketing of Knowledge Bank; charity fundraiser; information technology expertise.
Hawke's Bay Knowledge Bank is a non-profit community organisation at Stoneycroft, a homestead heritage digital library, preserving Hawke's Bay history for future generations.

The Napier Amateur Radio Club, also known as Branch 25 of the New Zealand Association of Radio Transmitters (NZART), is a friendly group of people with a wide variety of interests, mostly related to electronics and the mysterious propagation of electro-magnetic waves through the 'ether'(whatever that is). Apart from having a technological bent we also enjoy the company of like-minded people. Our activities range from construction to contesting to assistance with emergency communications if the need arises. Check our web-site!

President Wally Shuker can be contacted on (06) 843 5497. A Sunday morning radio 'Net' is operated in conjunction with the Hawke's Bay Radio Club (based in Hastings, Branch 13 of NZART) starting 9am. Frequencies: 3.615 MHz and the Clifton repeater on 439.175 MHz.
Tuesdays 6pm - 8pm and Sundays 10am - 1pm at Whitmore Park in Napier.
Learn to skate. Learn to play Inline Hockey. Participate in Inline Hockey.

Inline Hockey is a sport akin to ice hockey without the ice and it is played on inline skates (rollerblades). The rules are also slightly different but still great fun! Napier Sharks Inline Hockey has been a part of the local roller sports community for over 20 years providing Inline Hockey to Napier and the wider Hawkes Bay area. We offer those who want to play or learn to play Inline Hockey a safe, fun environment to do so. We have experienced members to help guide you along the way. We do have some equipment available to use. Please let us know if you are interested and we'll accommodate as best we can.
We operate daily from Mondays - Thursdays

We welcome volunteer drivers and volunteers willing to assist in the running of our programmes.

Heretaunga Seniors is a charitable organisation which has been operating for over 20 years. Our mission is to support older people to live independently in the community for as long as possible and to enhance their quality of life. We offer hall-based activities from Monday to Thursday and outreach services to older people living in their own homes, with a particular focus on the very aged, ie adults from 70 - 80yrs plus.

While we operate under the umbrella of Anglican Care Waiapu, Heretaunga Seniors is a self-funding centre dependent upon the goodwill and energy of a team of 28 volunteers with approx. 100 members and a small part-time staff of three.

Age Concern is a charitable organisation dedicated solely to people over 65. We promote dignity, wellbeing, equity and respect and provide expert information and support services in response to older people's needs. Local Age Concerns throughout New Zealand are the first port of call for older people in their communities. Age Concern offers expertise and knowledge of all available services for older people as well as social activities.

Visit Ahuriri and discover a seaside suburb steeped in history but with a contemporary vibe. Ahuriri's rich cultural heritage includes world-class Art Deco architecture, historic cottages and renovated woolstores featuring distinctive saw-tooth rooflines. With more than 20 cafes, bars and restaurants in walking distance, you'll never go hungry here. Wander around and discover an eclectic mix of eateries, galleries, businesses and boutique stores. There's so much to see and do outdoors - walkways, cycle tracks, family-friendly beaches, water sports and an estuary with protected wildlife as well as huge, hand-painted murals with an eco theme. Check out ahuriri.co.nz to find out more!
